snippet: A federal judge agreed with arguments that a new state law was motivated by politics, not science. He temporarily blocked enforcement to close the clinic pending a hearing in 11 days.
abstract: Jackson Women's Health Organization, Mississippi abortion clinic scheduled to be shut down for non-compliance with new state law requiring doctors to be obstetrician-gynecologists at local hospitals, remains open after Judge Daniel P Jordan III of Federal District Court temporarily blocks enforcement; clinic, which is the state's only abortion provider, receives rush of calls from women seeking abortions before next round of battle in the courts.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge agreed with arguments that a new state law was motivated by politics, not science. He temporarily blocked enforcement to close the clinic pending a hearing in 11 days.

headline.main: Mississippi’s Lone Abortion Clinic, Given Temporary Reprieve, Fields Rush of Calls
headline.print_headline: Mississippi’s Lone Abortion Clinic, Given Temporary Reprieve, Fields Rush of Calls
